meanings.sent1: The weeds in the garden were eradicable with the right tools.
meanings.sent2: The virus was eradicable with the new medicine.
meanings.sent3: The eradicable pests in the attic made the cat's job easier.
meanings.sent4: Her fear of heights was eradicable with each step she took on the ladder.
meanings.sent5: The eradicable stain on the carpet vanished with a simple cleaning solution.

meanings.definition: Able to be completely destroyed or removed.
meanings.sent1: The eradicable mold on the wall needed immediate attention.
meanings.sent2: The invasive species was eradicable through careful management.
meanings.sent3: The eradicable graffiti on the wall was an eyesore to the neighborhood.
meanings.sent4: His doubts were eradicable once he saw the evidence.
meanings.sent5: The eradicable odor in the room disappeared after airing it out.
